item.title: Metaphor ReFantazio: How To Pass Test of Courage (At Your Own Risk Trophy)
item.description:
Players must complete the Test Your Courage activity to unlock the At Your Own Risk Trophy in Metaphor ReFantazio . There are 40+ trophies in the game, while some unlock as players progress through the story, others are missable. These trophies are mostly tied to in-game events on certain dates or involve completing an optional NPC activity. The At Your Own Risk Trophy is one of the latter.

Completing the Test Your Courage activity is simple enough, but it's easy to skip out on it, which prevents you from taking that one step in unlocking all the trophies in Metaphor ReFantazio . Here's everything you need to know about this activity and how to unlock the At Your Own Risk trophy associated with it.

Complete Test of Courage to Unlock At Your Own Risk Trophy in Metaphor ReFantazio

To complete the Test of Courage activity, players will have to find the "Spirited Youth" NPC located in the Thoroughfare Square in Martira . Once you've unlocked Martira City, head north from the market until you see a wooden platform on the cliff and NPCs standing next to it.

Once you approach the NPCs, you'll be able to interact with one of them, who's the "Spirited Youth" and he'll put out a simple challenge in front of you. Do a bungee jump from the wooden platform to test your courage. The 'Spirited Youth' will inform the protagonist that they'll fare better if they have courage, and ask for a rope fee of 250 reeve to attempt the jump.

Once you select the "I'll take the Plunge" option, a cutscene will play, and you'll be rewarded with an increase in Courage Virtue stat. To unlock the 'At Your Own Risk' trophy, players will need to attempt the challenge a total of 3 times , with the rope thinning at every attempt and the fee increasing up to 500 reeve.

Once players have completed the last attempt of the challenge, they'll get a boost in Courage stats while also receiving an item, a "Foreign Coin." Completing the challenge's final attempt also unlocks the "At Your Own Risk" trophy in Metaphor ReFantazio .

This activity requires a high level of courage, preferably rank 5, in the final attempt. It's recommended to increase your Royal Virtue courage stat before being eligible for the activity.

item.title: Monopoly GO: Habitat Heroes Rewards & Milestones
item.description:
After the conclusion of the Riches On Top event, Monopoly GO is now featuring a new solo event called Habitat Heroes . It kicks off on Oct 20 and will last for two days, ending on Oct 22 .

The Habitat Heroes Monopoly GO event features 46 milestones , and by completing all of them, you can snag around 18,000 dice rolls and various sticker packs. In addition to that, you can earn tons of cash and other rewards as well. This article will provide all the important details about Habitat Heroes Monopoly GO, including its rewards and milestones.

7,500 Free Dice Rolls, Five-Star Sticker Pack

How To Get Points In Habitat Heroes Monopoly GO

To secure the grand prize of 7,500 dice rolls and a five-star sticker pack , you will need to hit all 46 milestones. In total, you can win up to 17,965 dice rolls and various stickers for the Marvel GO album. To accumulate points in Habitat Heroes Monopoly GO , you must land on the Chance, Community, and Railroad tiles across your board.

As a base rate, you'll get one point for Chance and Community, and two points for each landing on the Railroad tiles . However, this can be increased with the help of dice multipliers. Therefore, you should consider using high multipliers if you have sufficient dice rolls.

item.title: Stardew Valley Fan Designs LEGO Version of Pierre's General Store
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Stardew Valley's community showcases dedication through fan creations like LEGO models of in-game locations.
  • The release of Update 1.6 for PC has led to increased player count spikes and fan celebration.
  • Players have created fun fan art, LEGO builds, guides, and crafts in anticipation of the update's expansion to mobile and console.

The indie farming life simulator Stardew Valley has amassed an incredibly dedicated community that frequently shares fan crafts dedicated to the game, including one player's LEGO model of Pierre's General Store. Stardew Valley has seen impressive player count spikes thanks to the release of Update 1.6 for PC, which is set to expand to mobile and console in November, and the community has been celebrating by sharing fun creations inspired by the beloved game.

First released in 2016, Stardew Valley sees players taking on the role of an up-and-coming farmer in the countryside of Pelican Town. Players can farm, forage, mine, fish, and craft their way through the game while exploring the local town and meeting the residents of Stardew Valley . Many of the in-game locations have become virtual landmarks among the title's fan base, and a number of players over the years have used their creativity to bring these locations to life.

Stardew Valley player Minifigdisplayco shared a look at their highly-detailed LEGO reproduction of the iconic General Store of Pelican Town. In the game, players can pay a visit to Pierre at his General Store to buy cooking ingredients, decorative items, tree saplings, and produce seeds in Stardew Valley . Pierre's General Store can be found to the north of the Pelican Town Square, near Mayor Lewis 's house, the Stardrop Saloon, and Harvey 's Clinic. Wanting to bring this popular spot from the game to life, OP utilized an innovative LEGO design to make a scale model of Pierre's General Store and the attached Clinic. Their LEGO model features the familiar sloped rooftops and facades of these important in-game buildings, and the LEGO recreation even sports an adorable little marquee sign for Pierre's General Store.

Stardew Valley LEGO Pierre's General Store

Fellow Stardew Valley players applauded the incredible scale model, with many noting that it would make a fantastic LEGO set if ever made as official merchandise. Several commenters suggested other buildings that would pair well with the set, including Pierre's chief competitor, JojaMart. While many of the key locations in Stardew Valley would translate perfectly to LEGO form, this design is just a fan creation and not an indicator of any official products. However, fans have voiced their interest in the idea, and many have already begun breaking out their extra LEGO to try their hand at their own Stardew Valley -inspired builds.

As audiences prepare for the console and mobile release of Stardew Valley Update 1.6, the community is actively sharing more fun fan creations, such as LEGO builds, updated player guides, and handmade crafts. From big gameplay additions with official updates to exciting community-made content, fans have plenty to enjoy with Stardew Valley .

item.title: Life Is Strange: Double Exposure - How to Get Gwen's Book
item.description:
Life Is Strange: Double Exposure is a narrative adventure game available on numerous modern platforms. The game features many choices for players to make that can completely alter how the story is told, but there are some scenes that will be present no matter what players have done up to said scene.

One such scene is when the players meet Gwen Hunter for the first time. In this scene, Gwen will be trying to get hold of a book that is sealed behind a glass case and will ask Max if she is able to help her out. This scene will take place while Max is going to meet with Yasmin Fayyad , who is the mother of Max’s friend Safi.

Help Gwen Find Her Book

Players will progress through Chapter 1, hopefully finding all the collectible Polaroids along the way, and eventually go to meet . Players will be meeting and interacting with several other key NPCs during this time — including Gwen Hunter. Gwen will first be encountered in front of a locked cabinet of books, and interacting with her can have the players choose for their first meeting to start with a hug or not. She will ask Max if she is able to break into the cabinet for her to get the book.

Expand your horizons with this genre-bending essay collection! Celebrated online essayist Augustina Nnadi has compiled new and experimental writings in this explosive collection, which mixes memoir with fiction to make the reader question where her real life ends and her imaginated one begins. Find me on shelf 12!

Max will say that anything skinny and curved should work, indicating what they should be looking for. Players will want to leave through the door they came through to find Gwen and turn left. Once you leave the room, head straight towards Vinh Lang at his desk. On the wall to the left of Vinh will be a coffee machine. The player can have Max pick up a spoon from the cup on the table that they can use to open the case.

There is actually another version of this book available in the library that players will come across if they go exploring. However, bringing it to Gwen will have her say that the one in the case is a special 10th anniversary edition, including a new introduction by its author.

Players can now retrieve the book from the case for Gwen and wrap up their conversation with her. This is not the last the players will see Gwen, and they can expect to see her again as early as Chapter 2.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for October 21, 2024
item.description:
Strands is back with one more challenging puzzle, this time for October 21, 2024. If you want to try out an extremely difficult puzzle game, this is a great one to start with. To win, you need to use every single letter just once while finding all nine of the themed words inside.

But if it's a little too challenging for you, no problem either. This article will help guide you; it contains everything you need to win today, including general clues, word spoilers, an explanation of the puzzle, and even the full answer if you want it.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #232 October 21, 2024

The Strands puzzle for October 21, 2024, has the clue We're In This Together . It contains nine hidden words: the Spangram and eight themed words.

New York Times Games Strands Clues

For some general clues that won't spoil any of the answers in this innovative puzzle game, check out the three sections below. All three of these sections have just one little hint inside that will help you get closer to the theme.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

If a spoiled word or two would be beneficial to you, but you don't want to look for non-themed words to save up for an in-game hint, check out the two sections below. Each one has just one spoiled word and a screenshot of where it goes in the puzzle grid.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

If you just want the complete answer for this browser-based puzzle game, look into the expandable section below. It contains all the themed words and screenshot of where to put all those words in the puzzle's grid.

Today's Strands Explained

Don't get this puzzle today? In the section below, you can find a full explanation for how the clue and the theme go together in this free mobile game similar to Wordle.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.
